meanings.definition: Faded in advance of actual use or exposure.
meanings.sent1: The prefaded curtains looked dull and worn before they were even hung up.
meanings.sent2: The prefaded photograph had lost its color before it was even taken out of the album.
meanings.sent3: The prefaded shirt made it seem like the laundry detergent was playing a prank on me.
meanings.sent4: Her prefaded memories of childhood seemed like distant dreams, barely visible in the light of day.
meanings.sent5: The prefaded painting on the wall was a reminder of the passage of time, slowly erasing its beauty.

meanings.definition: To have faded before being used or exposed.
meanings.sent1: The colors prefaded on the old flag, showing its age and history.
meanings.sent2: The fabric prefaded in the sun, losing its vibrancy over time.
meanings.sent3: The artist prefaded the edges of the canvas to create a vintage look.
meanings.sent4: The memories prefaded in his mind, becoming blurry with each passing year.
meanings.sent5: The words on the sign prefaded, making it difficult to read from a distance.
